alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 4:36PM CDT until April 26 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .The combination of snow melt and rainfall has resulted in rising river levels along the Yellow River. This will produce moderate flooding along this river in the Necedah area. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Wednesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 17.8 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.2 feet on 04/13/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 445 AM CDT.
